author: GromGrommeta
body:
KMI: Debt, increasingly less relevant industry, and management that doesn't give two shits if shareholders see a return on their investment. I believe Buffett sold out of them because of management concerns a few years back.

Don't be a sucker for dividends, often times a high-yield masks a failing business.

Take V or MA as a replacement for DFS. I'd probably include a small percentage allocated to JPM for big bank exposure, they'll turn around eventually.

SHOP or AMZN are fine, frankly I'd make a whole e-commerce section for AMZN, SHOP, MELI, SE, ADBE. You'll likely thank me in a few years.

Don't like ANET, would rather EQIX. I assume you mean CRWD which is definitely an option. Cloud plays: VEEV, OKTA, AYX, RNG, BAND, many others.
You could look at using the SKYY ETF for exposure to most of the companies in the sector instead of betting on individual small/mid-caps. There's also the WCLD etf which has seen a pretty big run-up this year.

author: HoodSamaritan420
body:
In descending order: SHOP, TSLA, AMZN, NFLX, NVD, TTD, MASI, MA, ZM, APPL, ANET, MKL, CGNX, BRK.B, ILMN, APPN, IDXX, NKE, GOOG, SNPS, SHW, COST, IIPR, ZNGA, DIS, CGC, BABA, GWPH, CNI, OGI, CRON, MTN.

I know I’m probably spread too thin and should condense it down to 15-20. My mindset was to buy and hold for decades because I’m only 30 but I did some recent reorganizing when shit hit the fan in March. It was hard for me to start investing, I come from a family who only put their money in CDs, Money markets, and other types of savings accounts. I figured I’d have less risk if I picked a lot of different stocks but regretting it a little because it’s also less reward when a stock does really well. Probably going to get more aggressive and use some of the recommendations I’ve seen in recent posts

author: dreammanalishi
body:
PAYC

PCTY

ANET

RBBN

off the top of my head... those have been up and down enough to make me more money than some of the meme stocks but are along the same vein.

Generally, finding stocks related to meme stocks works best for me because by the time you see a news article or a post the market has already reacted.

Certain correlated tickers and even ETFs often experience a delayed reaction, making it easier to buy and sell it for a fraction of a percent a few hundred times in a couple of days.

author: quaeratioest
body: Another big variable is demand. Companies like ANET have backlogs of orders for years out.

author: bestrongbelieve
body:
I'm using MF Stock Advisor right now and it is actually a pretty good service. They recommend high-quality companies and do better DD than you will typically find on Reddit or Stocktwits. The company seems scammy because of their marketing tactics, but the paid content has been worth the modest subscription fee.

**Current Tops Stocks (6/14/20)**: $ANET, $ZM, $TTD, $TSLA, $CRWD, $OKTA, $NVDA, $NFLX, $MTCH, $ZNGA, $GMED

So, like, not *super secret stocks* or something, but really solid companies and they do a nice job of breaking down the thought process behind the recommendations. They introduced me to $SHOP, $ZM, $TTD, and $CRWD over the past few months and all of them made me money.

author: studiox_swe
body: Yea so have Cisco HPE extreme juniper arista - my point is that if someone believes that radios is everything they haven’t even looked at the revenue
